ovdesc.p: The FATCA.XML.REQUEST is used to generate the XML message, as per the FORM 8966,
for all the reportable clients. The report can be generated for either a single CUSTOMER,
ACCOUNT.OFFICER or ALL customers. If a Pool report has to be generated, the ID will be POOL .

desc.p: The field identifies the year to which the generated XML pertains to.
A valid year.
This fields will accept values NEW/CORRECTION/VOID/AMEND.
The default value will be NEW which means the message is being generated for the first time.
When a XML that has been generated needs to be corrected then Corrected Data is used for records being re-transmitted after the IRS has notified the sender of a
problem with the file or underlying data. Corrected Data should ONLY be used when responding
to an IRS request to correct the data. (not used for Decryption, XML or other file-level errors).
Void Data is used to erase previously-filed records when data needs to be re-transmitted.
Amended Data is used to amend a record(s) previously transmitted to, received and processed
by the IRS, but is later found to contain erroneous information.
Based on ACTION selection following need to updated in REPORT.TYPE.
FATCA1 = New Data
FATCA2 = Corrected Data
FATCA3 = Void Data
FATCA4 = Amended Data

The field is associated with POOL.STATUS.TYPE and is used to specify whether the report has to be generated for clients with indicia or without indicia.
If the field is left blank, the report will be generated for all the clients with FATCA STATUS equal to the status in POOL.STATUS.TYPE..
